data.text: There is a reproof that is not comely;
How good is it to reprove, rather than to be wroth;
Verse 3 is omitted by the best authorities.
As is the lust of an eunuch to deflower a virgin;
There is one that keepeth silence, and is found wise;
There is one that keepeth silence, for he hath no answer to make;
A wise man will be silent till his time come;
He that useth many words shall be abhorred;
There is a prosperity that a man findeth in misfortunes;
There is a gift that shall not profit thee;
There is an abasement because of glory;
There is that buyeth much for a little,
He that is wise in words shall make himself beloved;
The gift of a fool shall not profit thee; A line of this verse is here omitted by the best authorities.
He will give little, and upbraid much;
The fool will say, I have no friend,
How oft, and of how many, shall he be laughed to scorn! The latter part of verse 17 is omitted by the best authorities.
A slip on a pavement is better than a slip  with the tongue;
A man without grace is as  a tale out of season:
A Gr. parable.  wise sentence from a foolâ€™s mouth will be rejected;
There is that is hindered from sinning through want;
There is that destroyeth his soul through bashfulness;
There is that for bashfulness promiseth to his friend;
A lie is a foul blot in a man:
A thief is better than a man that is continually lying:
The disposition of a liar is dishonour;
He that is wise in words shall advance himself;
He that tilleth his land shall raise his heap high;
Presents and gifts blind the eyes of the wise,
Wisdom that is hid, and treasure that is out of sight,
Better is a man that hideth his folly
Verse 32 is omitted by the best authorities.
